Package battleship

Class Ship

java.lang.Object
battleship.Ship
Direct Known Subclasses:
Battleship, Cruiser, Destroyer, EmptySea, Submarine
public abstract class Ship
extends java.lang.Object
Abstract class describing the characteristics common to all ships.

    • okToPlaceShipAt

      boolean okToPlaceShipAt​(int row, int column, boolean horizontal, Ocean ocean)
      Based on given parameters, returns true if it is okay to put a ship of this length with its bow in this location otherwise, returns false The ship must not overlap another ship or touch another ship (vertically, horizontally, or diagonally), and it must be fully contained within the array. Does not modify the ship or ocean.
      Parameters:
      row -
      column -
      horizontal -
      ocean -
      Returns:
      true/false

    • getShipExtent

      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getShipExtent​(int row, int column, boolean horizontal)
      Helper function. Finds the ship's "extent" given row, columns, and orientation. E.g., a horizontal battleship with its bow placed in column 9 would return the ArrayList: [9, 8, 7, 6], signifying that it extends over 4 columns.
      Parameters:
      row -
      column -
      horizontal -
      Returns:

    • checkNeighbors

      private boolean checkNeighbors​(int row, int column, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> extent, boolean horizontal, Ocean ocean)
      Helper function. Check all the neighboring cells for a proposed ship. If any of those cells is occupied, return true. Otherwise, return false.
      Parameters:
      row -
      column -
      extent -
      horizontal -
      ocean -
      Returns:

    • placeShipAt

      void placeShipAt​(int row, int column, boolean horizontal, Ocean ocean)
      Places a ship in the ocean using the given parameters. Also puts a reference to the ship in the relevant locations in the ships array in the ocean object Assume that horizontal ships have their bow at the right end, and vertical ships have their bow at the bottom end
      Parameters:
      row -
      column -
      horizontal -
      ocean -

    • shootAt

      boolean shootAt​(int row, int column)
      Returns true if a part of the ship occupies the given row and column, and the ship hasn't been sunk. Otherwise, return false
      Parameters:
      row -
      column -
      Returns:
      true/false

    • isSunk

      boolean isSunk()
      Returns:
      true if every part of the ship has been hit, false otherwise

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a single-character String for use in the Ocean's print method. Returns "s" if the ship has been sunk and "x" if not. This method can be used to print out locations in the ocean that have been shot at
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
